DOC.HEAD: 12 Killed in Collapse of Apartment Building in Egypt
Eds: New thruout to UPDATE fatalities to 12, search over. No pickup.
DOC.TEXT: Twelve people were killed and 12 injured when an apartment building collapsed under the weight of three stories that were added to the structure illegally, police said today. Rescue workers ended their search early today after pulling the last four bodies from the rubble, police said. The building, which collapsed late Friday night, was inspected recently after cracks appeared in some of its walls, residents said. The government architect who examined the cracks did not condemn the building, they said. The six-story building, located in the middle-class residential district of Glim, originally had three stories, police said. But they said its owners added another three stories without obtaining building permits. ``The foundations of the house, designed to support only three stories, apparently could not withstand the weight of another three,'' said a police officer, speaking on condition of anonymity. It was not known when the three additional floors were added. The fatalities included a family of four related to the landlord, two 2-year-old children, a man and his wife, two women and two Jordanian students. Police said people living in six of the apartment house's 10 units were traveling at the time of the collapse.
